text:
Today I'm gonna show you the five things
I'm doing with my money right now in

preparation for what many are calling
the 2020 recession now just the

disclaimer I'm just some unqualified
random guy on the internet with no

financial background whatsoever so
everything I'm about to say for the rest

of this video is simply my opinion I
don't know for sure what's gonna happen

with the economy in the future I'm just
here to tell you what I'm currently

doing with my money you need to do more
research on your own and use your best

judgment when it comes to your money
with that being said let's dive right

into it now I am someone who likes to
consider as many scenarios as possible

including the ones that are most
commonly associated with tinfoil hats so

the first thing I did was use some of my
money to ensure the safety of my family

close friends and loved ones
so back in early February when this

whole crisis started unfolding I
immediately spent a couple thousand

dollars sending out supplies to a couple
of households around the world these

shipments included about two months of
non perishable goods for every person

some basic medical supplies survival
gear and even some means of self-defense

I'm serious I ordered a couple of
machetes and crossbows which might be a

little bit too much but we are currently
seeing an increase in looting and food

shortages around the world so who knows
anything could happen and I feel like

it's better to be prepared than to be
sorry money comes second to the health

and safety of your family and loved ones
now that the people I care about were

provided for it was time for me to think
about myself which is why the second

thing I did with my money was to make
sure that I had an emergency fund

available on hand see I'm currently
stuck overseas in Vietnam which is

actually an extremely good thing because
they've been handling the virus

situation extremely well props to you
Vietnam but even then I'm still

considering all the possibilities I
absolutely do not want to be stuck in

another country all by myself without
any money you need money I'm talking

about physical cash to do things
weathers to buy more food to move around

quickly or even to get someone to do you
a favor all of those things are

currently bartered for with money money
is power and I realized that I might

need to use some of this power to save
my ass

something were to happen to me because
nobody else is watching out for me when

I'm in another country I have to watch
out for myself here so I went to the

local Western Union and I started taking
out cash every day until I had a good

amount in both the Vietnamese dong and
also the USD enough for me to survive

for at least three months
the third thing I'm doing with my money

is making sure I have more money in
general it's been said that times of

crisis are where millionaires are made
and there's some truth to this right if

the stock market plunges and I have cash
sitting on hand theoretically I would be

in a good position to invest we recently
had a drop of about 30 percent from all

time highs in the stock market it could
go down to 40 heck even 50 no one really

knows a regardless of how low it goes if
I have extra money laying around I'll be

able to take advantage of this and pick
up stocks at a huge discount so I'm

making sure that I'm making more money
which is why I've been working really

hard every week significantly more than
I used to planning out six to eight

videos a month as compared to the two to
four that I usually did before and it's

interesting because I've noticed that
most of my friends back home are

basically doing the opposite they're
telling me about how bored they are

stuck at home with nothing to do playing
video games and surf and social media

all day whenever I hear this I can't
help but shake my head because my

mentality right now is that every dollar
I make could potentially be worth $2

it's double money time it's time for me
to grind extra hard to do whatever I can

to make more money because I'll be able
to hit my financial goals twice as fast

now having more money is not just about
making more money it's also about

spending less money it's double
expensive time every dollar I spend now

cost me double so I've been cutting cost
wherever I can

I've unsubscribed to a bunch of services
I don't really use that much I even

started cooking at home more and this
actually brings us to the sponsors of

today's video honey honey is an
extremely easy free online shopping tool

that will allow you to save money on
just about anything you decide to

purchase online when you use honey it
automatically looks up coupons for you

and tries to save you money there's no
catch it does this all for absolutely

free honey has access to coupons for
over 30 thousand stores

line which is why they have over 17
million users with over two billion

dollars in savings and rest assured
they're part of the PayPal and venmo

family so you know they're legit not
having honey is literally passing up on

saving free money get honey for free
today by going to WWE

Ford / pill and just a reminder guys one
of the best ways to help support this

channel is by simply checking out our
sponsors that way they'll want to work

with us again in the future
honey is absolutely free so you'll be

doing me a huge favor by simply
downloading it and using the tool to

save yourself money the fourth thing I'm
doing with my money is making what I

consider to be smart bets this is a
concept I took from Ray Dalio who is

considered to be one of the best
investors in the world he talks more

about this in his book principles
basically it works like this imagine

that you make a $10 bet on something
that has a 50/50 chance of being right

or wrong say a coin flip if you are
writes you will end up with $100 if you

are wrong you will end up with zero in
cases like this even though you only

have a 50% chance of being right it can
be worth it to play assuming you have

extra money laying around because even
though you could lose everything

you wager you still have an equally high
chance of 10x in your money and I took

this principle to heart and I've been
applying it a lot these past couple of

months I'll give you an example so back
in January I decided to move all of the

money in my retirement fund out of the
stock market I called up my financial

advisor and he was saying things like no
no just stay in it's silly to try in

time the market and he's right if you
try to time the market you usually fail

but I have a very high risk tolerance
and I had a strong belief that this

little virus in wuhan would really shake
things up on a global scale so in my

head I felt like there was a 50% chance
that I would be right and that a big

drop would occur in the markets within
the next six months if I was right I

figured that I would be able to prevent
my retirement fund from losing about 25

percent of its value if I was wrong I
would probably only lose out on around

5% of gains because the SMP only raises
about 8 to 10% per year and I planned on

only staying out for half a year so in
my head this was a fifty fifty percent

chance bed
that could either save me 25% or cause

me to lose 5% of my entire portfolio if
my portfolio was worth $100,000 I would

end up either saving $25,000 or losing
$5,000 I felt like this was a smart bet

so I decided to gamble and luckily I was
right and I was able to prevent a little

over 30% in losses for my entire
retirement portfolio I took this idea of

making smart bets even further and I
decided to short the market in March

when the pandemic really started ramping
up in speed in the USA and I was able to

5x the money I put in I am still on the
lookout for new smart bets constantly

looking for opportunities again it's
important to note that I am NOT a

qualified financial expert do not try to
do any of these things without

consulting your financial adviser first
truth be told I consider myself to be

more of a gambler not an investor
because of my high risk tolerance

meaning that I am okay with losing all
of the money I wager when it comes to

these smart bets it's extra money that I
have laying around never ever bet money

that you can't afford to lose and
finally the last thing I'm doing with my

money right now is buying insurance and
I don't mean life insurance or car

insurance I mean money insurance okay
the thing is we live in unprecedented

times there's a lot of uncertainty in
the world right now

no one is sure what's gonna happen with
the economy and in cases like this I

think it's smart to buy some insurance
in the form of gold or silver even Ray

Dalio has a portion of his portfolio
invested into gold now gold isn't really

an investment in the sense that you
can't really rely on it to make you more

money it's more like a safe place where
you can park some of your money just in

case things go really really south so
I've been buying physical gold and

silver just to be on the safe side of
things and that's it these are the five

things that I've been doing with my
money right now basically using it to

take care of my loved ones and myself
making sure I have more money so I can

make more smart bets and finally buying
insurance just in case make sure you

subscribe and hit that Bell icon for
more wealth related videos that I plan

on releasing soon down the line
besides that guys stay tuned
and stay safe
